study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the regulatory effects of traditional Chinese medicine, including Astragalus, on the Th17/Treg axis imbalance and its potential mechanisms in immune-mediated inflammatory diseases.
results_summary: The study found that Astragalus and other TCM herbs modulate the Th17/Treg axis, influencing immune balance, but specific efficacy data for Astragalus alone were not detailed. Frequency analysis of TCM prescriptions indicated common use in clinical trials.
population_specificity: Patients with immune-mediated inflammatory diseases (IMID)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of different Chinese herbal injections, including Astragalus polysaccharide injection, when combined with TACE for treating liver cancer.
results_summary: Astragalus polysaccharide injection plus TACE showed superiority in clinical effective rate and performance status compared to other Chinese herbal injections, but its safety profile was not specifically addressed.
population_specificity: Patients with liver cancer (7,683 patients across 105 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent progress on Astragaloside IV (AS-IV) in heart failure (HF) and provide potential evidence for its clinical application.
results_summary: The study found that AS-IV could protect against myocardial ischemia and regulate sarcoplasmic reticulum Ca, suggesting potential benefits for chronic heart failure (CHF) patients.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic heart failure (CHF).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Astragalus membranaceus (AM) as an adjunctive therapy in cancer treatment, focusing on its anti-tumor effects, immune modulation, and potential to reduce chemotherapy side effects.
results_summary: AM was found to shrink or stabilize tumors through anti-proliferation and pro-apoptosis effects, enhance anti-tumor efficacy when combined with chemotherapy, and improve systemic immunity to potentially prevent metastasis. It also activated immune cells in the tumor microenvironment.
population_specificity: Cancer patients and various cancer models/cell lines (not specified further).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent experimental studies on the effects of Astragalus polysaccharides in treating diabetes mellitus and its complications.
results_summary: The study found that Astragalus polysaccharides showed promising effects in treating diabetes mellitus, including improvements in insulin resistance and secretion, as well as potential benefits for diabetic complications like neuropathy, retinopathy, cardiomyopathy, foot ulcers, and infections.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of experimental studies, likely involving animal models and/or human trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of astragaloside IV (from Astragalus) combined with tanshinone IIA on myocardial ischemic injury and inflammatory markers in patients with coronary heart disease.
results_summary: The study assessed multiple inflammatory markers and clinical symptoms but did not report specific results for Astragalus alone. The abstract indicates the trial is expected to provide valuable clinical evidence for CHD management.
population_specificity: 160 patients with coronary heart disease.
study_duration: 7 days of treatment, followed by 28 days of follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically summarize the pharmacological effects, pharmacokinetics, and toxicity of Astragaloside IV (AS-IV), focusing on its neuroprotective, liver-protective, anti-cancer, and anti-diabetic properties.
results_summary: The study found that AS-IV exhibits potent protective effects in cardiovascular, lung, kidney, and brain tissues, attributed to its antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and anti-apoptotic properties. It also enhances immunity, reduces cancer cell migration and invasion, and improves chemosensitivity, acting through multiple signaling pathways.
population_specificity: Cellular and animal models (not specified for human trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review existing data on the effects of Astragalus membranaceus and other medicinal plants on male gonads, focusing on mechanisms like antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and spermatogenesis-inducing properties.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that Astragalus membranaceus, among other plants, has demonstrated mechanisms of action in laboratory animals, in vitro, and human studies, including antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and spermatogenesis-inducing effects. However, clinical application efforts remain limited.
population_specificity: Laboratory animals, in vitro studies, and human studies (unspecified demographics).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of PG2 (Astragalus polysaccharides) injection on adverse events and quality of life in patients with advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma undergoing concurrent chemoradiotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that PG2 injection reduced severe treatment-associated adverse events and improved quality of life (particularly in pain, appetite loss, and social eating behavior) compared to placebo, though it did not affect tumor response or survival outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced pharyngeal or laryngeal head and neck squamous cell carcinoma undergoing concurrent chemoradiotherapy.
effective_dosage: PG2 injection administered three times per week (sterile powder form).
study_duration: Duration of concurrent chemoradiotherapy (specific length not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the mechanism of immune cells in liver fibrosis and the regulatory effects of Astragalus membranaceus and its active components on immune cells.
results_summary: The study suggests that Astragalus membranaceus and its active components may modulate immune cells to influence hepatic fibrosis and liver cirrhosis, offering potential therapeutic insights.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article, not a clinical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of Astragalus membranaceus (Huangqi) as an adjuvant therapy for managing post-stroke fatigue and improving quality of life.
results_summary: The study found that Astragalus reduced fatigue severity and improved quality of life in stroke patients, with mild adverse effects. However, the evidence was of poor quality due to high or unclear risks of bias in the included trials.
population_specificity: Post-stroke patients experiencing fatigue (total of 1222 participants across 16 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Astragalus membranaceus preparations as an adjunctive therapy to conventional treatments for diabetic kidney disease (DKD).
results_summary: The meta-analysis suggested that Astragalus injections, when added to conventional therapies, reduced albuminuria, proteinuria, and serum creatinine in DKD patients, though the evidence quality was low due to methodological limitations and heterogeneity.
population_specificity: Diabetic kidney disease (DKD) patients (4,785 participants across 66 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effects of Astragalus membranaceus extracts on autophagy dysregulation-associated diseases.
results_summary: The study found that Astragalus extracts exhibit biological activities related to autophagy, including anti-oxidation, anti-inflammation, anticancer, anti-photoaging, and improvement of cardiomyocyte function, suggesting therapeutic potential for autophagy-related diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (literature review).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effects of saponins, including those from Astragalus, on intestinal inflammation and related digestive diseases.
results_summary: The study found that saponins, including those from Astragalus, can suppress intestinal inflammation, promote barrier repair, maintain gut flora diversity, and reduce colon-inflammation-related cancer incidence.
population_specificity: Animal models (not specified further).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the benefits of Astragalus injection (AGI) as an adjuvant to platinum-based chemotherapy in advanced nonsmall cell lung cancer (NSCLC) patients.
results_summary: AGI combined with chemotherapy improved objective response rate, Karnofsky performance status, 1-year survival rate, and immune markers (CD3, CD4, CD4/CD8, NK cells) while reducing leukopenia, platelet toxicity, and vomiting. However, the evidence quality was rated as low.
population_specificity: Advanced nonsmall cell lung cancer (NSCLC) patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the current research status of JQJTT (which includes Astragalus) for diabetes treatment, identify existing problems, and propose future research directions.
results_summary: The study found that JQJTT, containing Astragalus, is effective for diabetes but highlighted issues like incomplete quality control, unclear pharmacological mechanisms, and the need for clinical reevaluation. Future research directions include improving quality assessment and exploring interactions with gut microbiota and pharmacokinetics.
population_specificity: Patients with diabetes (specific population details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to confirm whether Aidi injection (containing Astragalus) improves tumor responses and survival in NSCLC patients, while assessing its safety, optimal usage, and combination with paclitaxel.
results_summary: Aidi injection plus paclitaxel-based chemotherapy significantly improved clinical efficacy, quality of life, and reduced adverse reactions like hematotoxicity, gastrointestinal toxicity, and liver injury in NSCLC patients. Optimal usage was suggested as 50 ml/time and 14 days/2 cycles.
population_specificity: Patients with stage III/IV non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
effective_dosage: 50 ml/time, 80 ml/time, or 100 ml/time; 14 days/2 cycles or 21 days/2-4 cycles.
study_duration: Varied by cycle (14 days/2 cycles or 21 days/2-4 cycles).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neuroprotective effects of Astragaloside IV (AS-IV) in experimental models of neurological disorders.
results_summary: The study found that AS-IV improved motor deficits and neurochemical activity in models of Parkinson's disease, Alzheimer's disease, cerebral ischemia, and autoimmune encephalomyelitis, primarily through antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and antiapoptotic mechanisms.
population_specificity: Experimental models (animal or in vitro studies) of neurological disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Danggui Buxue Tang (DBT) supplementation on exercise performance, hepcidin levels, iron status, and related biochemical parameters after intense aerobic exercise.
results_summary: DBT supplementation significantly improved running performance (14.0% faster finish times), repressed hepcidin levels post-exercise, and increased iron levels by 63.3% and 31.4% at different recovery points, but showed no significant anti-inflammatory or haemolysis-preventative effects.
population_specificity: 36 recreationally active males, pair-matched based on aerobic capacities.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and tolerability of SH003, a novel herbal medicine containing Astragalus, in patients with solid cancers.
results_summary: The study assessed toxicity using CTCAE criteria and defined dose-limiting toxicities as grade 3 or higher adverse events, but efficacy results were not reported in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients with solid cancers.
effective_dosage: One to four tablets of SH003, three times a day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of Astragalus as an adjuvant in cancer treatment, focusing on its ability to enhance efficacy and reduce side effects of chemo-, radio-, or targeted-therapy.
results_summary: Astragalus was found to suppress tumor progression, increase sensitivity to conventional therapies, improve immune function, and lessen therapy-induced damage. It also showed benefits in reducing cancer-related fatigue, pain, and gastrointestinal side effects.
population_specificity: Cancer patients undergoing chemo-, radio-, or targeted-therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Aidi injection (containing Astragalus) in combination with platinum-based chemotherapy for stage IIIB/IV non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
results_summary: The study found that Aidi injection plus platinum-based chemotherapy improved disease control, response rates, survival rates, and quality of life while reducing severe toxicities compared to chemotherapy alone. The results were statistically significant and clinically meaningful.
population_specificity: Patients with stage IIIB/IV NSCLC (4,081 participants across 42 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of different doses of Astragalus membranaceus (AM) on diastolic function in postmenopausal hypertensive women with metabolic syndrome (MetS).
results_summary: The study found that AM at 10 g/d significantly improved diastolic function markers (E', E/A, E'/A', E/E') compared to conventional treatment alone. Waist circumference and waist-to-hip ratio were identified as potential risk factors for left ventricular diastolic dysfunction (LVDD).
population_specificity: Postmenopausal hypertensive women with metabolic syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Astragalus (Huangqi) preparation in treating acute myocardial infarction (AMI) through a meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The study will provide evidence on Astragalus's effects on cardiac function (e.g., LVESV, LVEDV, LVEF), clinical outcomes (e.g., mortality, arrhythmias), and safety, but specific results are pending completion of the meta-analysis.
population_specificity: Patients with acute myocardial infarction (AMI).

study_goal: The study aimed to describe radiological evaluations, classification systems, and biomechanical patterns involved in talar fractures, not Astragalus.
results_summary: The study did not investigate Astragalus; it focused on talar fractures, their complications, and treatment strategies.
population_specificity: Patients with talar fractures or traumatic talar dislocations.

study_goal: To investigate the correlation between the clinical effects of Astragalus (Huangqi) on diabetic nephropathy (DN) and its pharmacological effects on macrophage iNOS activity.
results_summary: Meta-analysis and randomized controlled trials showed that Astragalus had therapeutic effects on different stages of DN and could regulate iNOS activity in macrophages, inducing nitric oxide (NO) production in resting macrophages and inhibiting it in activated macrophages.
population_specificity: Patients with diabetic nephropathy (stages III and III-IV) and macrophages in resting or activated states.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of HT042 (containing Astragalus) on height growth in children with mild short stature.
results_summary: HT042 significantly increased height gain in children after 24 weeks, particularly in those below the 10th percentile, without advancing bone age. Serum IGF-1 and IGFBP-3 levels increased within the HT042 group, suggesting a potential mechanism for the observed effects.
population_specificity: Children aged 6-8 years with height below the 25th percentile.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the immunoregulatory and anti-inflammatory effects of Astragaloside (ASI), a major component of Astragalus, and explore its potential mechanisms, including CD45 phosphatase activation and IFN-γ induction.
results_summary: The study found that ASI enhances CD45 phosphatase activity, regulates T-cell balance, inhibits pro-inflammatory cytokines and NF-κB pathways, and may induce IFN-γ activity, supporting its traditional use in immune-related diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the cardioprotective effects of Astragalus polysaccharide against doxorubicin-induced cardiotoxicity in preclinical trials.
results_summary: The study found that Astragalus polysaccharide exhibited antioxidant properties and inhibited apoptosis, suggesting potential cardioprotective effects against doxorubicin-induced toxicity. Unlike synthetic agents, it did not impair the clinical activity of doxorubicin and was deemed safe for long-term use.
population_specificity: Preclinical trials (animal or in vitro models, not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effects and mechanisms of Astragalus (as part of compound Chinese medicine) on microcirculatory dysfunction and organ injury following ischemia and reperfusion (I/R).
results_summary: The study found that Astragalus and other compound Chinese medicines exhibit protective and therapeutic effects against I/R-induced microcirculatory dysfunction and tissue injury, with mechanisms including energy metabolism regulation, antioxidant effects, and anti-inflammatory actions.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of preclinical and clinical studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the pharmacological actions and molecular mechanisms of Chinese herbs, including Astragalus, in lowering the risk and progression of diabetic retinopathy.
results_summary: The study found that Chinese herbs, including Astragalus, exhibit anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, anti-angiogenic, and other beneficial activities that counteract pathological conditions in the retina during diabetes, suggesting potential for treating or preventing diabetic retinopathy.
population_specificity: Diabetic retinopathy patients (implied, not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness and safety of oral Astragalus as a sole intervention for preventing frequent acute respiratory tract infections (ARTIs) in children.
results_summary: No randomized controlled trials (RCTs) met the inclusion criteria, so there was insufficient evidence to evaluate the effectiveness or safety of Astragalus for preventing ARTIs in children.
population_specificity: Children aged up to 14 years in community settings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of PG2, a polysaccharide extracted from Astragalus membranaceus, on patients with spontaneous acute intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH).
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in clinical outcomes (GOS and mRS scores) or inflammatory markers between the treatment and control groups, suggesting PG2 did not significantly improve outcomes in ICH patients. The results were preliminary, indicating a need for further assessment.
population_specificity: Patients with acute spontaneous intracerebral hemorrhage (61 participants, 30 in treatment group, 31 in control group).
effective_dosage: 500 mg, IV, 3 doses per week for 2 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize existing data on the use of Chinese herbal medicine, including Astragalus, for promoting recovery in hematologic disorder patients undergoing hematopoietic stem cell transplantation.
results_summary: The study found Astragalus was commonly prescribed post-HSCT to promote engraftment, control graft-versus-host disease, and prolong survival, but the evidence was based on small, mostly retrospective studies with heterogeneous objectives.
population_specificity: Patients with hematologic disorders who received hematopoietic stem cell transplantation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of Astragalus membranaceus (AM) on poststroke fatigue (PSF) in patients.
results_summary: AM significantly improved fatigue (BFI scores), cognitive functioning, social functioning, and global quality of life (QOL) compared to placebo, with statistically significant differences observed at multiple time points.
population_specificity: 64 patients with poststroke fatigue (29 in treatment group, 32 in control group after attrition).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the pharmacological effects, metabolism mechanism, and toxicity of astragaloside IV (AS-IV), the main active substance of Astragalus membranaceus Bunge.
results_summary: AS-IV demonstrated multiple pharmacologic effects, including anti-inflammatory, antifibrotic, antioxidative stress, anti-asthma, antidiabetes, immunoregulation, and cardioprotective effects via various signaling pathways, with potential for broad clinical application.
population_specificity: Not specified (general pharmacological review)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of Astragalus, in combination with other plant-based medicines, on reducing chemotherapy-induced neutropenia in colorectal cancer patients.
results_summary: Astragalus, when combined with other plant-based ingredients, was consistently associated with reduced incidence of grade 3/4 chemotherapy-induced neutropenia. No serious adverse events or reduction in tumor response rates were reported with its concurrent use alongside oxaliplatin.
population_specificity: Colorectal cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy (2224 participants across 32 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects and safety of Kang'ai Xiaoshui ointment (containing Astragalus) in reducing malignant pleural effusion and alleviating associated symptoms.
results_summary: The treatment group showed a higher response rate (42.4% vs. 25.0%) and significant improvement in symptoms like chest distress, fullness, and shortness of breath, though some symptoms did not reach statistical significance. Adverse events, mainly skin irritation, were equally distributed between groups.
population_specificity: 72 patients with malignant pleural effusion.
effective_dosage: Applied on the thorax wall for 8 hours daily (specific Astragalus dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the biological actions and signaling pathways of Astragalus polysaccharides in treating oxidative stress- and cancer-related diseases.
results_summary: The study found that Astragalus polysaccharides exhibit anti-oxidant, anti-inflammatory, immune-regulatory, and anti-tumor effects, primarily through ROS-centered and transcription factor-related pathways. These effects were observed in cell models, animal disease models, and clinical cases.
population_specificity: Not specified (general oxidative stress and cancer-related disease models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the properties of Astragalus membranaceus and its major constituents, focusing on its immunomodulating, anti-inflammatory, and anticancer effects, particularly in gastrointestinal cancers.
results_summary: The study found that Astragalus and its saponin extract (AST) demonstrated significant immunomodulatory, anti-inflammatory, and anticancer effects, particularly in gastrointestinal cancers, by influencing immune responses and modulating cancer signaling pathways.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on experimental and clinical studies).
interactions: Mentioned interaction with immunosuppressants and cancer chemotherapeutics, reducing their toxicity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of Astragalus as an adjuvant treatment for type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) through a meta-analysis of existing studies.
results_summary: Astragalus administration significantly reduced fasting plasma glucose (FPG) and postprandial plasma glucose (PPG) in both injection and aqueous decoction forms, with aqueous decoction also reducing fasting insulin (Fins) and HOMA-IRI levels. However, glycated hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) reduction was only significant with aqueous decoction, not injection.
population_specificity: 1054 participants with type 2 diabetes mellitus across 13 studies.
effective_dosage: Not specified (studies included Astragalus injection and aqueous decoction, but exact dosages not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether combining Astragalus with oxaliplatin-based regimens improved tumor response rates in colorectal cancer patients.
results_summary: The study found that Astragalus, particularly in combination with Hedyotis and Scutellaria, contributed to higher tumor response rates in palliative CRC treatment. The effect was statistically significant and consistent across multiple trials.
population_specificity: Colorectal cancer patients in China or Japan receiving oxaliplatin-based chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent findings on the chemistry and bioactivities of tetracyclic triterpenoids, including those from Astragalus membranaceus, particularly in relation to diabetes and its complications.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that tetracyclic triterpenoids, including those from Astragalus membranaceus, are widely distributed in medicinal plants used for diabetes treatment, but specific results regarding Astragalus's effects are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Astragalus, among other traditional plant-based medicines, in reducing chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting (CINV) in patients receiving oxaliplatin-based regimens.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that Astragalus, as part of an integrative approach, significantly reduced CINV compared to oxaliplatin controls, with mechanisms potentially involving gastrointestinal regulation and antioxidant effects. The study identified Astragalus as one of six plants associated with notable reductions in CINV without significant heterogeneity.
population_specificity: Patients with colorectal cancer undergoing oxaliplatin-based chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antidiabetic properties of Astragalus membranaceus and its bioactive compounds (polysaccharides, saponins, flavonoids) in treating diabetes mellitus and its complications.
results_summary: The study highlights Astragalus's potential antidiabetic effects, particularly its polysaccharides, saponins, and flavonoids, which show promise in addressing type 1 and type 2 diabetes through mechanisms like improving insulin resistance and glucose metabolism. However, specific clinical outcomes are not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Not specified (general diabetes mellitus population, including type 1 and type 2).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the therapeutic potential of natural compounds, including Astragalus, in suppressing keloid scar development by targeting signaling pathways involved in keloid formation.
results_summary: The study suggests that Astragalus, among other natural compounds, may suppress keloid scar development by modulating signaling pathways like TGF-β1, MAPK, IGF-I, and integrin. However, specific efficacy data for Astragalus alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of keloid disorder mechanisms and potential treatments).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the benefits and potential harms of Astragalus for treating chronic kidney disease (CKD).
results_summary: Astragalus showed some promising effects, such as reducing proteinuria, increasing hemoglobin and serum albumin, and improving kidney function markers like CrCl and SCr, but results were inconsistent, and study quality was low. No adverse effects were reported in six studies, while the remaining 16 did not mention them.
population_specificity: People with chronic kidney disease (CKD), including 241 dialysis patients.

study_goal: To assess the efficacy and safety of Astragalus membranaceus Injection combined with conventional therapy in the treatment of viral myocarditis.
results_summary: Astragalus membranaceus Injection combined with conventional treatment showed higher efficacy than conventional treatment alone, with significant improvements in myocardium enzyme levels and electrocardiography. However, the conclusion is limited by low methodological quality, small sample size, and high risk of bias.
population_specificity: 639 participants with viral myocarditis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical efficacy and safety of Astragalus polysaccharides injection combined with FOLFOX regimens versus FOLFOX alone in treating gastric cancer.
results_summary: The study found that Astragalus polysaccharides injection, when combined with FOLFOX, improved overall response rate, quality of life, and reduced nausea, vomiting, and leukopenia incidence compared to FOLFOX alone. It was ranked among the superior Chinese herb injections for gastric cancer treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with gastric cancer (2,761 participants across 38 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Astragalus membranaceus could upregulate Cosmc expression and reverse IgA1 aberrant glycosylation in peripheral B lymphocytes of IgA nephropathy (IgAN) patients.
results_summary: Astragalus membranaceus injection (AMI) significantly upregulated Cosmc expression, decreased IgA1 secretion, and reversed aberrant glycosylation in a dose-related manner in IgAN patients' B lymphocytes. LPS-induced suppression of Cosmc and increased IgA1 secretion were counteracted by AMI.
population_specificity: 21 IgAN patients and 10 normal controls.
effective_dosage: Not specified (dose-related effects noted but exact amounts not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the pharmacological effects, bioactive components, and safety profile of Semen Astragali Complanati (SAC) in treating chronic diseases.
results_summary: SAC contains fatty acids, amino acids, polysaccharides, flavonoids, and triterpene glycosides, with flavonoids being the main bioactive component. It exhibits therapeutic effects on chronic diseases like cardiovascular diseases, diabetes, and cancers, with low or non-existent toxicity.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the α-glucosidase inhibitory effects of polysaccharides extracted from Astragalus compared to oyster mushroom and Yacon, to assess their potential as natural hypoglycemic agents.
results_summary: Astragalus polysaccharides showed the highest α-glucosidase inhibitory activity among the tested substances, with over 40% inhibition at 0.4 mg·mL(-1) and an IC50 of 0.28 mg·mL(-1). The results suggest Astragalus polysaccharides may be effective as a dietary supplement or therapeutic for diabetes.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent reports on the potential effects and mechanisms of action of calycosin, a bioactive compound in Astragalus, for treating various diseases.
results_summary: The study found that calycosin shows promising effects in treating tumors, inflammation, stroke, and cardiovascular diseases, likely due to its isoflavonoid and phytoestrogenic properties, interacting with ER receptors and modulating the MAPK pathway.
population_specificity: Not specified (literature review of preclinical and clinical studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the clinical value of Huangqi injection (derived from Astragalus) in treating leucopenia through a meta-analysis of controlled trials.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that Huangqi injection-treated patients showed greater therapeutic efficacy and lower white blood cell counts compared to control groups using Western medicine (P < 0.05), but the validity was limited by poor study quality.
population_specificity: 841 patients with leucopenia across 13 studies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical benefits of adding herbal medicines, including Astragalus, to FOLFOX4 chemotherapy for advanced colorectal cancer, focusing on tumor response, survival, quality of life, and adverse event reduction.
results_summary: The addition of Astragalus and other herbal medicines improved tumor response rate, one-year survival, and quality of life while reducing severe chemotherapy-related adverse events such as neutropenia, nausea, vomiting, and neurotoxicity.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced colorectal cancer receiving FOLFOX4 chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize and analyze the anti-Parkinsonian activities of herbal medicines, including Astragalus, in PD models to provide future references for basic and clinical investigations.
results_summary: Astragalus was among the herbal medicines reported to be effective in PD models by modulating key events or signaling pathways implicated in PD pathogenesis. The study suggests Astragalus and other herbal medicines may be valuable candidates for further anti-Parkinsonian drug discovery.
population_specificity: PD models (in vitro and in vivo)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the benefits and harms of herbal medicines, including Astragalus membranaceus, on clinical and indirect outcomes in patients with viral myocarditis.
results_summary: Astragalus membranaceus injection did not significantly reduce mortality but showed significant improvements in abnormal electrocardiogram results, ST-T changes, and reductions in creatine phosphate kinase (CPK) and lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) levels when combined with supportive therapy. However, the findings should be interpreted cautiously due to high risk of bias and limited trial quality.
population_specificity: Patients with viral myocarditis (acute and chronic) in China.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the mechanisms by which Astragalus may treat heart failure, focusing on myocardial contraction, cardiac cell protection, neuro-endocrine regulation, cytokine modulation, and left ventricular remodeling.
results_summary: The study found that Astragalus may improve heart failure through multiple mechanisms, including enhancing myocardial contraction, protecting cardiac cells, regulating neuro-endocrine systems, modulating cytokines, and inhibiting left ventricular remodeling.
population_specificity: Not specified (literature review of existing studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether Astragalus (Huangqi granules) could effectively reduce the risk of infection in children with nephrotic syndrome.
results_summary: The study found that Huangqi granules significantly reduced the risk of infection in children with nephrotic syndrome (RR 0.62, 95% CI 0.47 to 0.83), with no serious adverse events reported. However, the methodological quality of the studies was poor, limiting the strength of the evidence.
population_specificity: Children with nephrotic syndrome in China.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of Astragalus membranaceus injection, in combination with supportive therapy, on clinical and indirect outcomes (e.g., electrocardiogram results, myocardial enzyme levels) in patients with viral myocarditis.
results_summary: The meta-analysis showed that Astragalus membranaceus injection plus supportive therapy significantly improved abnormal electrocardiogram results, ST-T changes, and reduced creatine phosphate kinase (CPK) and lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) levels. No serious adverse effects were reported, but data on adverse events were limited.
population_specificity: Patients with viral myocarditis (all trials were conducted in China).
study_duration: Minimum of seven days (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Astragalus polysaccharide (APS) combined with vinorelbine and cisplatin (VC) improved quality of life (QOL) and reduced chemotherapy toxicity in patients with advanced NSCLC compared to VC alone.
results_summary: The study found that APS combined with VC significantly improved QOL, physical function, and reduced chemotherapy-related side effects (fatigue, nausea, vomiting, pain, and loss of appetite) compared to VC alone, though it did not significantly improve tumor response or survival rates.
population_specificity: Patients with histologically or cytologically confirmed advanced non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
study_duration: 3 cycles of treatment (duration per cycle not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the angiogenic effect of astragaloside IV (a constituent of Astragalus) and its underlying mechanism in human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs) under hypoxia.
results_summary: Astragaloside IV promoted cell proliferation, stimulated HIF-1α accumulation, activated the PI3K/Akt pathway, enhanced cell migration, increased tube formation, and promoted angiogenesis, with effects reversed by a PI3K inhibitor.
population_specificity: Human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs) under hypoxia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of PG2, a partially purified extract of Astragalus membranaceus, as a complementary treatment for cancer-related fatigue (CRF) in advanced cancer patients.
results_summary: PG2 significantly improved CRF compared to placebo, with sustained benefits in most patients after two treatment cycles. Approximately 71% of non-responders in the first cycle showed improvement after the second cycle, and no major toxicities were observed.
population_specificity: Advanced cancer patients with moderate to severe cancer-related fatigue.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of bariatric surgery versus multidisciplinary programs for substantial and durable weight loss in obesity treatment.
results_summary: The study found that bariatric surgery achieved substantial and durable weight reduction, unlike conservative multidisciplinary programs, though the metabolic and pro-inflammatory benefits of post-surgery weight loss remain debated.
population_specificity: Individuals with obesity for whom conservative treatments have failed.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of early bariatric surgery to improve outcomes in adolescents with severe, progressive type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that bariatric surgery has great potential to transform outcomes for adolescents with type 2 diabetes, though it remains controversial. The majority of adolescents rapidly progress to treatment failure with conventional therapies like metformin and insulin.
population_specificity: Adolescents with severe, progressive type 2 diabetes.
